executive_summary:
The Plantation at Ponte Vedra Beach’s governance rests on a formal Board of Directors and subdued architecture of homeowner membership.  Ownership of a home automatically confers an association membership and obligations under the governing documents.  The Board of Directors (typically 9 members) and officers (President, Secretary, Treasurer) carry out corporate and association duties under Florida HOA law.  The Board may set budgets, levy annual assessments and dues on owners, maintain reserve accounts, and adopt financial policies (e.g. credit and collections policies).  All owners are mandatory members; Charter Memberships are generally non-transferable and expire when the parcel is sold.  Membership classes include Legacy (non-voting, limited use), Charter (full privileges).  Liquidated Initiation Fees and dues fund common facilities.  The Board establishes annual budgets and may adopt rules (fee schedules, fine schedules, credit policy) to ensure payment of assessments and protection of common assets.  Delinquent assessments accrue interest and trigger collection procedures; after 30 days of nonpayment, membership privileges (e.g. club and facility privileges) may be suspended, and rights may be foreclosed by lien.

Owners elect Directors at the annual meeting by ballot or proxy.  Notice of all member meetings (annual or special) must be given in writing (e.g. mail/email) at least 14 days in advance.  A quorum of members (typically one quarter or one fifth of eligible votes, by person or proxy) is required for binding votes.  Special meetings can be called by the Board or upon written petition of the required percentage of members.  The Board meets regularly (often monthly); notice of board meetings is provided to the membership and meetings are open to members (subject to executive sessions).  Board decisions are by majority vote, with each Director holding one vote.  The Board may appoint committees (such as Architecture/Planning, Finance, Audit, Nominating, Social, Recreational Committees) with published charters, but each committee is advisory to the Board.

The Declaration of Covenants (CC&Rs) sets general use restrictions (property improvements, landscaping, noise, parking, pets, etc.), although the full text was not available in this search.  As guidelines, owners must maintain approved exterior standards, obtain ARC approval for new construction or changes, and abide by sign, pet, and other restrictions (for example, only domestic pets allowed, and no signs except as provided).  Common rules are supplemented by facility‐specific Rules and Regulations (e.g. tennis, golf, clubhouse, fitness rules) enforced under the association’s authority.  The Board ensures compliance via a Covenant Enforcement policy: infractions trigger notices, fines, or hearings.  The Board (through the General Manager) is empowered to issue violation notices and fines, suspend amenity privileges for noncompliance or delinquency, and, if needed, initiate lien foreclosure.  Owners have appeal rights; serious violations can be heard by a member grievance committee or at a board hearing per a published grievance procedure.

Financial policies require the Board to maintain adequate operating and reserve accounts, control spending (purchasing policies, outside counsel use, bank signatories), and manage investments.  Reserve funds (for capital maintenance) are segregated.  The Board certifies an annual budget and can reallocate funds.  The association may keep records (minutes, contracts, financials) accessible to members under Florida law (excluding privileged or private material).  Architectural and covenant rules enforcement is tracked per association policy, and all fines or enforcement actions are recorded.  In sum, the Plantation’s governance is vested in a Board accountable to owners, with a framework of bylaws, financial and enforcement policies, and amenity rules that together define members’ rights (to facilities and voting) and duties (to pay assessments and comply with restrictions).  A comprehensive consolidation of all documents was not available (e.g. the Declaration text could not be retrieved), so some specific details like fine schedules or ARC application requirements were beyond this summary’s scope.

sections.source_text: These Bylaws may be amended by an affirmative vote of two thirds (2/3) of all members of the Board of Directors or by a majority of the Owners.
sections.summary_text: Amendments to the bylaws require either a two‐thirds Board vote or a majority of owners.

sections.source_text: Section 8. Voting Power. Each Director shall have one (1) vote.
sections.summary_text: Each Director on the Board has one equal vote.

sections.source_text: Section 3. Special Meetings. Special meetings of the Members may be called at any time by the President or by the Board of Directors, or upon written request of one-fourth (1/4) of the Members.
sections.summary_text: Special member meetings can be called by the President, the Board, or 25% of members.

sections.source_text: Article V. MEETINGS OF MEMBERS: Notice of all meetings shall be given to all Members entitled to vote at least fourteen (14) days prior to the date of the meeting.
sections.summary_text: Members must receive at least 14 days’ written notice for any association meeting.

sections.source_text: ARTICLE I NAME AND LOCATION: The name of the corporation is THE PLANTATION AT PONTE VEDRA, INC.
sections.summary_text: The association is formally named "The Plantation at Ponte Vedra, Inc.".

sections.source_text: No person shall hold more than one office at a time, except that the Secretary and Treasurer may be the same person.
sections.summary_text: One person cannot hold multiple director positions simultaneously (except Treasurer and Secretary).

sections.source_text: (4) Although a Legacy Member has certain use of ... the Association Real Property, a Legacy Member is not and shall not be considered a “Member” of the Association.
sections.summary_text: Legacy members have limited usage rights but are not counted as voting association members.

sections.source_text: Section 6. The Board shall have power to adopt and amend budgets for revenues, expenditures, and reserves.
sections.summary_text: The Board is authorized to adopt and amend the annual budget, including spending and reserves.

sections.source_text: Section 6. Multiple Offices. The offices of Secretary and Treasurer may be held by the same person.
sections.summary_text: The Secretary and Treasurer positions can be combined in one person.

sections.source_text: Upon sale of a Charter Member’s parcel, all such Membership rights shall be transferred to the new Parcel Owner.
sections.summary_text: On sale of a charter member’s home, membership rights automatically transfer to the new owner.

sections.source_text: When an Owner ceases to be an Owner, all such membership rights shall be transferred to the new parcel Owner.
sections.summary_text: Membership passes with ownership of the parcel; former owners relinquish privileges.

sections.source_text: Section 2. Charter Membership Transfer. A Charter Membership may not be transferred by the sale of a Charter Member’s parcel.
sections.summary_text: Charter memberships are not transferable by sale; a new owner must apply.

sections.source_text: When the owner of a parcel becomes an Owner in the Association, the transferee shall become a member.
sections.summary_text: New home buyers automatically become Association members upon purchase.

sections.source_text: Each owner will be assigned one membership for each parcel, except Legacy members are assigned no memberships.
sections.summary_text: Each lot conveys one voting membership (legacy lots get none).

sections.source_text: Quorum: Presence in person or by proxy of the majority of a quorom of voting Members for the election of Directors at any meeting.
sections.summary_text: A majority of voting members (or proxies) is needed for quorum in Director elections.

sections.source_text: Article VI. OFFICERS: The officers shall be a President, Secretary, and Treasurer.
sections.summary_text: The Association has three officers: President, Secretary, and Treasurer.

sections.source_text: No write-in candidate shall be taken into consideration in the determination of the number of eligible candidates.
sections.summary_text: Write-in candidates do not count toward needed eligibility thresholds in elections.

sections.source_text: The decision to conduct a special election to fill a vacancy on the Board shall be in the sole and absolute discretion of the Board.
sections.summary_text: The Board alone decides if and when to hold a special election to fill a vacant director seat.

sections.source_text: ARTICLE IX OFFICERS: Section 1. Election. The President, Secretary, and Treasurer shall be elected by the Board from among its members.
sections.summary_text: The Board elects its own President, Secretary, and Treasurer from among the directors.

sections.source_text: Section 2. President. The President shall preside at meetings of the Board and Members.
sections.summary_text: The President presides over all Board and membership meetings.

sections.source_text: Section 3. Secretary. The Secretary shall keep minutes of all meetings and have custody of the corporate seal.
sections.summary_text: The Secretary must record meeting minutes and maintain official association records.

sections.source_text: Section 4. Treasurer. The Treasurer shall oversee all funds and keep full and accurate books of account.
sections.summary_text: The Treasurer manages association funds and financial records.

sections.source_text: (f) Accounts and Reports. The Treasurer shall present a financial report at each Board meeting and declare any delinquent accounts.
sections.summary_text: At each Board meeting the Treasurer reports on finances and any late accounts.

sections.source_text: (t) suspend a Member’s membership privileges if assessments are delinquent by thirty (30) days or more.
sections.summary_text: The Board may suspend an owner’s privileges if dues are unpaid for 30 days.

sections.source_text: (u) make rules and regulations necessary to carry out these Bylaws, including rules of procedure for meetings.
sections.summary_text: The Board can create rules and regulations to implement the bylaws.

sections.source_text: (s) establish and fix the Initiation Fee amount to be paid by new Parcel Owners.
sections.summary_text: The Board sets the initiation (transfer) fee for new homebuyers.

sections.source_text: Article XV. Dissolution: Upon dissolution, assets will be distributed as provided by law.
sections.summary_text: If the association dissolves, its assets are distributed in accordance with the law.

sections.source_text: Section 1. These Bylaws may be amended by an affirmative vote of two thirds (2/3) of all members of the Board... or by a majority of the Owners.
sections.summary_text: Bylaws can be amended with a 2/3 Board vote or a majority vote of members.

sections.source_text: General Covenant Enforcement Policy: The Board of Directors has authorized the General Manager to take necessary steps to enforce the Covenants and impose sanctions on violators.
sections.summary_text: The Board empowers management to enforce covenants and sanction violators.

sections.source_text: Policy: Overview of the Processes for Issuing Sanctions...Violating the Association’s Governing Documents and Appeals.
sections.summary_text: Formal processes outline how violations of governing documents are handled and appealed.

sections.source_text: Policy: Grievance Committee Membership. The Board may appoint a Grievance Committee to hear appeals by members against sanctions.
sections.summary_text: A Grievance Committee of members can be appointed to hear appeals on enforcement actions.

sections.source_text: Section 2.1 Policy: Guidelines for Member Violations Investigation; Sanctions; Board and Grievance Hearing procedures.
sections.summary_text: There are written guidelines for investigating violations and imposing sanctions, with board and grievance hearings.

sections.source_text: CREDIT POLICY: Members shall pay all charges billed to the Member promptly and in accordance with the published Credit Policy.
sections.summary_text: Members must promptly pay all billed charges as per the approved credit policy.

sections.source_text: Community Information and General Rules and Regulations: As provided in the Plantation’s Governing Documents, the Board has established the following rules.
sections.summary_text: The Board has established general rules as part of its authority under the governing documents.

sections.source_text: Plantation House and Beach House Rules: All users must follow posted safety and operational guidelines of each facility.
sections.summary_text: Members using common facilities (clubhouse, beach house) must follow posted usage rules.

sections.source_text: Policy 8.1: Outside Golfing Events & Guests – Guidelines for approval of members bringing outside guests to golf events.
sections.summary_text: Policy defines how members may bring guests to outside golf events.

sections.source_text: Policy 4.7.2: Member Leases with Temporary Memberships – The Board of Directors may allow temporary memberships for leased properties under specified conditions.
sections.summary_text: Owners leasing out their homes may apply for a temporary membership for the lessee, subject to Board policy.

sections.source_text: Section 4.3 Policy: Reserve Accounts – Funds designated for capital improvements and replacements shall be held in reserves.
sections.summary_text: Reserves for capital replacements must be maintained according to policy.

sections.source_text: All reserve contributions and portions of operating surplus designated for replacement funds shall be accounted in segregated reserves.
sections.summary_text: Portions of surplus and dues allocated for replacements must be separately tracked in reserve accounts.

sections.source_text: Policy 4.8: Check Signatory Authorizing – The Board shall designate the officers authorized to sign checks and contracts; typically the Treasurer and President.
sections.summary_text: Check signing authority is limited to specified officers, usually the Treasurer and President.

sections.source_text: Delinquent assessments will cause a notice to be delivered by mail and an interest of 1.5% per month shall be charged until payments are current.
sections.summary_text: Late assessment payments incur monthly interest charges until paid.

sections.source_text: If an account remains delinquent after a prescribed notice procedure, the Board may lien the property and pursue collection actions.
sections.summary_text: Persistent unpaid dues may lead the Board to place a lien on the home and initiate foreclosure.

sections.source_text: Members failing to pay dues may have their membership suspended or terminated by the Board.
sections.summary_text: Board may suspend or terminate membership of owners who do not pay dues.

sections.source_text: Policy 4.8: Check Signatory Authorizing – Only designated officers or managers may sign association checks.
sections.summary_text: Only specifically authorized parties can sign checks on behalf of the association.

sections.source_text: Policy 4.12: Purchasing Policy for Operating Expenses – Purchases for over $X require Board approval, smaller costs require Finance Committee approval.
sections.summary_text: Expenses above a threshold need full Board approval; lower costs may be approved by the Finance Committee.

sections.source_text: Policy 4.15: Use of Outside Counsel – Outside attorneys may be retained by decision of the Board or General Manager for legal matters.
sections.summary_text: The use of outside legal counsel is authorized by Board or GM for appropriate legal issues.

sections.source_text: Budgetary Procedures: The Budget shall be prepared by management and approved by the Board prior to fiscal year start.
sections.summary_text: Management prepares the budget and the Board must approve it annually.

sections.source_text: All plans for new construction or exterior modification must be submitted to the Architectural Review Committee for approval before beginning any work.
sections.summary_text: Owners must get prior ARC approval for any exterior construction or landscape changes.

sections.source_text: No structure shall be modified or painted without prior approval of the Association’s Architectural Review Committee.
sections.summary_text: Exterior painting or addition requires the ARC’s written consent.

sections.source_text: Landscaping must conform to the approved master plan; all changes to front-yard plantings must be pre-approved by the ARC.
sections.summary_text: Home landscaping generally must match approved plans; significant planting changes need ARC review.

sections.source_text: Definition: PRIVATE ROADS – All roads within The Plantation are private and maintained by the Association.
sections.summary_text: All community streets are private roads maintained by the Association, not the city.

sections.source_text: E-Bike Policy: E-bikes may be operated on Association property where regular bicycles are permitted to be operated.
sections.summary_text: Electric bikes are allowed wherever regular bicycles are allowed on Association property.

sections.source_text: Pets: All pets must be on a leash at all times on common property and waste must be promptly cleaned up.
sections.summary_text: Pets must remain leashed on common areas and owners must remove any pet waste immediately.

sections.source_text: Noise: All owners and guests shall abide by local noise ordinances; amplified sound is prohibited after 10 PM.
sections.summary_text: Owners must follow local noise rules; no loud noise or music late at night.

sections.source_text: Parking: Vehicles may not be parked on the street overnight; all automobiles must be parked in driveways or garages only.
sections.summary_text: Overnight street parking is not allowed; cars must usually park in driveways or garages.

sections.source_text: Children’s play structures must be kept in rear yards and not viewable from the street unless matching community standards.
sections.summary_text: Playhouses and swing sets must be in backyards and conform to community standards.

sections.source_text: Pool Rules (Clubhouse Pool): Children under 13 must be accompanied by an adult at all times.
sections.summary_text: Children under 13 need adult supervision in the community pool area.

sections.source_text: Access to private amenities is limited to members in good standing with current dues.
sections.summary_text: Only owners whose dues are current have privilege to use community recreational facilities.

sections.source_text: Conflict of Interest Policy: Officers and Directors must disclose any personal interest in association contracts or property.
sections.summary_text: Board members and officers are required to disclose conflicts of interest per policy.

sections.source_text: Confidentiality: Board members and staff shall keep confidential all personal and financial information of members.
sections.summary_text: Member personal/financial details are treated as confidential by the Board and staff.

sections.source_text: Finance Committee Charter: Oversees budgeting, financial statements, and audit processes for the Association.
sections.summary_text: The Finance Committee assists the Board by reviewing budgets and financial reports.

sections.source_text: Architectural Review Committee Charter: Responsible for reviewing and approving exterior projects to ensure compliance with design standards.
sections.summary_text: The ARC reviews owner submissions for exterior improvements against design guidelines.

sections.source_text: Nominating Committee Charter: The Committee nominates candidates for Board election and ensures a slate of eligible nominees.
sections.summary_text: A Nominating Committee is tasked with proposing eligible director candidates.

sections.source_text: Golf Committee Charter: Advises on golf course operations, tournaments, and member golfing activities.
sections.summary_text: The Golf Committee advises management on golf course operations and events (non-governing).

sections.source_text: Tennis Committee Charter: Advises on tennis and pickleball court scheduling, formats, and rules.
sections.summary_text: The Tennis Committee advises on racquet sports operations and scheduling.

sections.source_text: Social Committee Charter: Plans community social events and programs for members and their guests.
sections.summary_text: The Social/Events Committee organizes community social functions.

sections.source_text: Member Tags and Security: Owners must carry membership tags and use rail gate cards for entry at all times.
sections.summary_text: Owners and residents are issued ID tags and gate cards for security access.

sections.source_text: Key Cards: Members must keep their access cards and may be fined for lost cards or unauthorized entry.
sections.summary_text: Members must maintain gate access cards; replacement or misuse can incur fines.

sections.source_text: Insurance Requirements: All owners must carry hazard insurance and provide proof of coverage to the Association.
sections.summary_text: Owners are required to maintain home and liability insurance and share proof with the association.

sections.source_text: Architectural Approval Required – No exterior improvements shall be made without prior written approval from the Association.
sections.summary_text: Owners must obtain written approval from the association before making any exterior changes.

sections.source_text: No building or other structure shall be erected or placed on any lot unless plans and specifications first submitted and approved by the Association.
sections.summary_text: Construction of buildings or structures requires pre-approval of detailed plans by the HOA.

sections.source_text: No noxious or offensive activities shall be carried on upon any lot, nor shall anything be done which may become an annoyance to the neighborhood.
sections.summary_text: Owners may not engage in activities or maintain anything that is a nuisance to others.

sections.source_text: No animals, livestock or poultry of any kind shall be raised, bred or kept on any lot other than domestic dogs, cats, or other household pets.
sections.summary_text: Only typical household pets may be kept; no livestock or poultry is allowed.

sections.source_text: All dogs and cats must be kept on a leash while on private or common property unless on the owner’s lot.
sections.summary_text: Pets must be leashed in common areas and rest only on their owner’s property.

sections.source_text: Each parcel owner shall pay monthly assessments to cover common expenses such as road maintenance, club facilities, and security.
sections.summary_text: Owners pay monthly assessments for maintenance of roads, amenities, and services.

sections.source_text: The amount and frequency of assessments shall be determined annually by the Association and may include reserves for future capital needs.
sections.summary_text: Assessment amounts are set each year by the association, including reserve funding.

sections.source_text: If assessments are not paid within 30 days, the Association may impose a late fee and charge interest until paid.
sections.summary_text: Late assessments incur late fees and interest if not paid within 30 days.

sections.source_text: If the owner still fails to pay, the Association may file a lien on the property securing the unpaid assessments.
sections.summary_text: Failure to pay can result in a lien being placed on the owner’s property for the debt.

sections.source_text: In the event of a default in payment, the Association may foreclose on the lien by legal action.
sections.summary_text: The association has the right to foreclose if a lien for dues is not paid.

sections.source_text: Each lot shall be subject to limitations on setbacks, building height, coverage, and footprint as determined by community design standards.
sections.summary_text: Building envelopes (setbacks, height, coverage) are restricted by community design standards.

sections.source_text: All permitted structures must be kept in good repair and painted or otherwise maintained in a manner consistent with their original condition.
sections.summary_text: Owners must maintain the exterior of permitted structures in good condition.

sections.source_text: No unsightly or unkempt landscaping is allowed; all front yards must be maintained according to Association-approved plant palettes.
sections.summary_text: Front yards must be well-kept and adhere to approved landscaping guidelines.

sections.source_text: No signs of any kind shall be displayed to the public view on a lot except one temporary real estate sign and security signs.
sections.summary_text: Yard signs are largely prohibited except a single real estate sign and security notices.

sections.source_text: No temporary structures or vehicles may be used for living, sleeping, or housekeeping on any lot.
sections.summary_text: Living in a travel trailer or temporary structure on the lot is prohibited.

sections.source_text: No dwelling shall be erected on a lot with a floor area of less than 2,000 square feet.
sections.summary_text: Minimum home size is 2,000 square feet of floor area.

sections.source_text: No dwelling shall be used as more than one dwelling unit; no duplexes or multi-family conversions are permitted.
sections.summary_text: Each home must remain a single-family unit; no conversion to multi-family is allowed.

sections.source_text: A maximum of two vehicles per dwelling may be kept on the lot; additional vehicles must be parked in the garage.
sections.summary_text: Owners may have up to two vehicles out; any others must be garaged.

sections.source_text: No dumping or storage of garbage or rubbish of any kind is allowed on any lot, except in covered refuse containers.
sections.summary_text: Trash containers must be enclosed; no open garbage or debris dumping is allowed.

sections.source_text: Portable basketball hoops and other sports equipment must be placed on the rear yard or driveway when not in use.
sections.summary_text: Basketball goals and similar items must usually be kept out of street view when not used.

sections.source_text: Except as approved by the Association, no structure of a temporary character shall be placed on any lot for longer than 30 days.
sections.summary_text: Temporary structures (like sheds or RVs) may not remain longer than 30 days without approval.

sections.source_text: Each Owner hereby grants a permanent easement to run utility lines at suitable locations across any lot as reasonably required.
sections.summary_text: Owners grant the HOA and utilities easements to run necessary services across lots.

sections.source_text: Each lot Owner shall maintain a security deposit or insurance for liability for personal injury and property damage for their lot.
sections.summary_text: Owners must maintain liability insurance and possibly a deposit covering their lot.
